Entries.default:
The waters of the Deadfire are as flat and translucent as a sheet of stained glass, and a steady wind guides [Player Ship] along. The scent of a well-spiced stew rises from belowdecks.

[Specified 0] and [Specified 1] are perched on the gunwale, legs and fishing poles dangling over the water.
"Ready cannons to fire! All hands to battle stations!"
"Turn us away and get us out of here!"
After a tense, quiet moment, red froth rises in the roiling water. A mangled carcass surfaces like a nightmare before sinking slowly into the depths.
Fortunately, your sails catch the wind, pulling you out of the monster's path.
Below, your cannoneers groan and sigh in relief.
As the monster thrashes, [Specified 0] throws a rope to [Specified 3].
[Cast defensive wards on the ship.]

The beast closes fast, sinuous and sleek, but you know enough of the denizens of the deep to recognize the creature for the spines that don't quite break the surface of the water.

It's a barbed ravager, a gargantuan shark known for ramming ships - and sinking them.
With feet spread wide and arms outstretched, you raise your voice in chant, weaving defensive magic across the hull.

Suddenly, [Specified 0] stiffens.

[Specified 1] claps [Specified 0] on the back. "Relax, it was only a joke."

But [Specified 0] shrugs the hand off. "What in Ondra's name is that?"

You look. A dark shape moves under the water. It's almost at the edge of the horizon, but it's rapidly approaching.

[Specified 0] stands. "One of Galawain's spawn. It's coming right for us."

The deck thunders as your crew rushes to their stations below. 

[Specified 2] spins the wheel, bringing the port side of the ship around to face the monster just as a plume of water rises from the sea.

The surfacing beast is about thirty feet of scales, spines, and sinew. It looks like an enormous shark except for the wicked rows of spines running along its body. Each looks sharp enough to cleave a man in two.

Or puncture the hull of a ship.
The beast rams you. Your ship shudders, hurling [Specified 1] into the mast. The sailor slides to the deck, unmoving.

The surfacing beast is about thirty feet of scales, spines, and sinew. It looks like an enormous shark except for the wicked rows of spines running along its body. Each looks sharp enough to cleave a man in two.

Or puncture the hull of a ship.

Your sails catch the wind, but not quickly enough to pull you out of the monster's path. 

The beast rams you. Your ship shudders, hurling [Specified 1] into the mast. The sailor slides to the deck, unmoving.

The deck thunders as your crew rushes to trim the sails. 

[Specified 2] spins the wheel, turning the ship away from the monster just as a plume of water rises from the sea.

A sound like thunder rends the air, and the deck comes apart beneath your feet. For an impossibly long moment the world spins around you, and then you plunge into the water.

You hang in the water, stunned, pieces of lumber and steel sinking around you. You reorient yourself towards the surface and swim.
"I'm sure [Specified 0] will land a real prize someday."
"Cut the chatter, you two."
[Say nothing.]

"Caught myself a real prize the other day," [Specified 0] says. "Slipped off my hook, though."

"I keep telling you to use a bigger one." [Specified 1] chuckles. "Seem to recall that dark-eyed barkeep in Queen's Berth slipping off your hook, too."

[Specified 0] smirks and laughs. "Thanks for the vote of confidence, captain."

"Not if the fool doesn't invest in better tackle's all I'm saying," [Specified 1] says.

But [Specified 0] has stiffened. "You see that?"

"Aye, captain." [Specified 1] snaps out a salute with one hand, the other holding a tight grip on the pole.

A few minutes of blessed silence follows.

[Specified 0] breaks it. "Captain... maybe you should see this."
[Identify it.]

[Specified 5] stares out at the shape. "I... I think that's a barbed ravager."

A barbed ravager. A gargantuan shark known for ramming ships - and sinking them.
The ravager circles back toward you...
Below, your cannoneers stamp and cheer.
Serafen peers out at the shape. "It be a barbed ravager, cap! Big blinking fish! Fast as the wind and twice as bitey!"

"A barbed ravager... Ngati's assassin of the deep. Mother has sent us a worthy test."

TekÄ“hu lowers his shaking hand from shielding his eyes.
You can't discern anything about the shape speeding toward you.

The beast closes fast, sinuous and sleek, but you know enough of the denizens of the deep to recognize the creature for the spines that don't quite break the surface of the water.

It's a barbed ravager, a gargantuan shark known for ramming ships - and sinking them.
"No idea," [Specified 5] says. "But here it comes..."
With arms spread wide, [Specified 5] chants, weaving defensive magic across the hull.

The surfacing beast is about thirty feet of scales, spines, and sinew. It looks like an enormous shark except for the wicked rows of spines running along its body. Each looks sharp enough to cleave a man in two.

Or puncture the hull of a ship.
Your crew fires off a volley just as the creature comes within range. Water erupts as their shots converge, and the beast disappears.
"Bring us about to fire!"
[Throw a grenade at it.]
[Fill the sails with a summoned wind.]
"Keep on course! Full ahead!"

The ship picks up speed, and the beast falls behind, becoming a rapidly shrinking speck in the distance.

[Specified 2] charts a wide path around the monster's territory to avoid another encounter.
"Fire another volley! And hit the damn thing this time!"
"Get us out of here!"
The cannoneers unload a volley at the beast. Blood and smoke cloud the air, and the creature vanishes beneath the waves.
After a tense, quiet moment, red froth rises in the roiling water. A mangled carcass surfaces like a nightmare... before sinking slowly into the depths.
The beast rams you. Your ship shudders, hurling [Specified 1] into the mast. The sailor slides to the deck, unmoving.
"Fire all cannons! Kill the bastard!"

The ravager again surfaces - and the grenade goes directly into its gaping maw.

Its head vanishes in a cloud of cartilage and viscera. Bits of brain and muscle rain down upon the deck.

The ravager again surfaces - and the grenade sails wide of its gaping maw, only to hit the water with a disappointing plunk. 

The beast tears into the side of the ship.
The wind stirs, then gusts, and the sails go taught and full. [Player Ship] lurches ahead.

[Specified 2] grabs the wheel and wrestles it counterclockwise. Orders ring out belowdecks as cannons are primed. 

The ravager surfaces again, tearing into the side of the ship.
[Specified 0] runs to the rail, fishing pole in hand. As the ravager surfaces again, the sailor jabs at the monster, jamming the pole deep into its eye.
The deck pitches wildly, and with a terrified scream, [Specified 3] spins off of the deck and into the water.

[Specified 2] grabs the wheel and wrestles it clockwise. Orders ring out across the deck as riggers dance across the lines. 

The ravager surfaces again, tearing into the side of the ship.

The ravager appears before you like an apparition. It is impossibly fast - its mouth impossibly large and filled with an impossible number of teeth.

They're the last things you ever see.
"Fire the cannons!"
"Man overboard! Save [Specified 3]!"
[Fill the sails with a summoned wind.]
"Keep on course! Full ahead!"
[Throw a grenade at it.]

The ravager again surfaces - and the grenade goes directly into its gaping maw.

Its head vanishes in a cloud of cartilage and viscera. Bits of brain and muscle rain down upon the deck.
The wind stirs, then gusts, and the sails go taught and full. [Player Ship] lurches ahead.

The crew swallow air, catching their breath. Someone belowdecks laughs. The rigging creaks.

It's over.
[Specified 0] rushes to the side and throws a line overboard. Shortly thereafter, a sodden [Specified 3] climbs back over the rail.
"We're out of cannonballs, captain!" [Specified 0] shouts.
"We're out of cannonballs, captain!" [Specified 0] shouts.
"Well shit."
"We're out of cannonballs, captain!" [Specified 0] shouts.

The ship picks up speed, and the beast falls behind, becoming a rapidly shrinking speck in the distance.

[Specified 2] charts a wide path around the monster's territory to avoid another encounter.
The ravager circles back toward you...
"We're out of cannonballs, captain!" [Specified 0] shouts.
"Fire the cannons!"
"We're out of cannonballs, captain!" [Specified 0] shouts.
"Well shit."
"Get us out of here!"
Like breakers crashing against the shore, the ravager broadsides the ship.

A sound like thunder rends the air, and the deck comes apart beneath your feet. For an impossibly long moment the world spins around you, and then you plunge into the water.

You hang in the water, stunned, pieces of lumber and steel sinking around you. You reorient yourself towards the surface and swim.
[Sacrifice a crew member as bait and flee.]
You quickly take stock of your options...
[Throw [Specified 0] overboard.]
[Throw [Specified 1] overboard.]
[Throw [Specified 3] overboard.]
[Reconsider your options...]

The sailor's eyes widen as you shove the hapless sacrifice over the rail and into the sea.

As the water churns red, you call for a full-sailed retreat.
You decide not to sacrifice one of the hands to the beast.
[Sacrifice a crew member as bait and flee.]
You quickly take stock of your options...
[Throw [Specified 0] overboard.]

The sailor's eyes widen as you shove the hapless sacrifice over the rail and into the sea.

As the water churns red, you call for a full-sailed retreat.
[Throw [Specified 1] overboard.]
[Throw [Specified 3] overboard.]
[Reconsider your options...]
You decide not to sacrifice one of the hands to the beast.

You see no blood, no bits of sea monster, nothing to indicate your crew hit the creature.

They hold their breath...
Rekke stares at you blankly. After a few long, silent moments, his eyes widen, and he slowly shakes his head.
